intro: Monnina macrostachya var. normalis, commonly known as the silverleaf bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairie and dry woodland habitats. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
